correlations.description: Both the Hybrid Azure Integration Architecture and the Cloud-Native Application Security Model face threats related to unauthorized access and data tampering.
correlations.detailed_analysis: Unauthorized access to control planes and data tampering in transit are common threats across cloud architectures. Both models utilize Azure services, making them susceptible to similar attack vectors.
shared_mitigations: Utilize TLS encryption for data in transit
correlations.risk_aggregation_impact: The combined impact of these threats could lead to significant data breaches and service disruptions across both architectures.

recommended_actions.expected_benefit: Identify overlapping vulnerabilities and enhance security posture.

correlations.compliance_implications: Both architectures must adhere to GDPR and HIPAA standards, necessitating robust access controls and data integrity measures.

correlations.description: Mitigations such as regular RBAC audits and the use of Azure Key Vault are common across multiple threat models.
correlations.detailed_analysis: Shared mitigations enhance the overall security framework and reduce the risk of misconfigurations across different architectures.
shared_mitigations: Regularly review and update Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) policies
Utilize Azure Key Vault for sensitive credential management
correlations.risk_aggregation_impact: Implementing shared mitigations reduces the overall attack surface, benefiting multiple systems.

recommended_actions.action: Standardize RBAC policies across all Azure deployments
recommended_actions.expected_benefit: Minimize risks associated with misconfigured access controls.

correlations.compliance_implications: Standardized RBAC policies can help ensure compliance with industry regulations regarding access control.

correlations.description: Attack patterns involving DDoS attacks are prevalent in both the Hybrid Azure Integration Architecture and the Kubernetes Security Model.

shared_threats: Denial of Service on Kubernetes Applications
correlations.risk_aggregation_impact: The potential for service outages increases significantly when both architectures are targeted simultaneously.

recommended_actions.action: Deploy WAFs and DDoS protection across all services

correlations.compliance_implications: Failure to protect against DDoS attacks can lead to compliance violations, particularly in regulated industries.

correlations.description: Both the Hybrid Azure Integration Architecture and the On-Premises Data Center Model must comply with similar regulatory frameworks.

correlations.risk_aggregation_impact: Non-compliance in one area can lead to penalties affecting the entire organization.

recommended_actions.action: Conduct a compliance audit across all models
recommended_actions.expected_benefit: Ensure all architectures meet regulatory requirements.

correlations.compliance_implications: A unified compliance strategy can streamline efforts and reduce the risk of regulatory penalties.
